title: Chest Injury Treatment
author: WebMD Editorial Contributors

sections.heading: Call 911
bullets: Emergency medical assistance is critical for any serious wound to the chest.
Even if there are no external wounds, there may be internal damage.

items: Emergency medical assistance is critical for any serious wound to the chest.
Even if there are no external wounds, there may be internal damage.

sections.heading: 1. Begin CPR, if Necessary
content: If the person is unresponsive, has stopped breathing , or is gasping for air:
bullets: For a child, start CPR for children.
For an adult, start adult CPR.

content_blocks.text: If the person is unresponsive, has stopped breathing , or is gasping for air:
associated_bullets: For a child, start CPR for children.
For an adult, start adult CPR.

sections.heading: 2. Cover an Open Wound
bullets: Use a cloth, pad, piece of clothing, plastic, aluminum, or whatever is at hand.
If possible, cover two inches beyond the edge of the wound.
If blood bubbles up from the wound or you hear air passing through the chest cavity, tape cover down on three sides to prevent air from building up in the chest.
Do not remove any objects that have penetrated the chest.

sections.heading: 3. Stop Bleeding, if Necessary
bullets: Apply pressure over dressing to control bleeding.
If blood soaks through the dressing, apply additional dressing on top of old one.

items: Apply pressure over dressing to control bleeding.
If blood soaks through the dressing, apply additional dressing on top of old one.

sections.heading: 4. Position Person to Make Breathing Easier
bullets: If possible, place the person on the injured side or sitting up.

items: If possible, place the person on the injured side or sitting up.

sections.heading: 5. Monitor Breathing
bullets: If breathing becomes weak, apply CPR as instructed above.

items: If breathing becomes weak, apply CPR as instructed above.

sections.heading: 6. Follow Up
bullets: The medical team will assess the injury and stabilize the person.
A blood transfusion may be necessary if there is significant blood loss.
A temporary chest tube may be placed to remove air surrounding the lung , which could cause the lung to collapse. When a lung collapses, it is called pneumothorax.
Surgery is likely for a serious chest injury.
